metadata.title: CVE-2022-24895 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
Symfony is a PHP framework for web and console applications and a set ofreusable PHP components. When authenticating users Symfony by defaultregenerates the session ID upon login, but preserves the rest of sessionattributes. Because this does not clear CSRF tokens upon login, this mightenables same-site attackers to bypass the CSRF protection mechanism byperforming an attack similar to a session-fixation. This issue has beenfixed in the 4.4 branch.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-24895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

php-symfony - 6.4.5+dfsg-3ubuntu3
php-symfony-all-my-sms-notifier - 6.4.5+dfsg-3ubuntu3
php-symfony-amazon-mailer - 6.4.5+dfsg-3ubuntu3

criterions.comment: symfony package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.4.5+dfsg-3ubuntu3').
